channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

item.title: Report X-2023090660
item.description:
Report X-2023090660

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-17T15:12:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-09
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO US BY THE IC BELT MANAGER. HE NOTICED IT IN A LINED TOTE BUT THE PACKAGE HAD SOME WETNESS. WE DISCOVERED THAT 2 OF THESE PLASTIC BOTTLES/CANS HAD LEAKED OUT INTO THE ENTIRE PACKAGE WHICH CONTAMINATED EVERYTHING IN THE BOX. DescribePack: 2 LOOSE CAPS DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: MADE SURE TO GET THE LINED TOTE TO THE HAZMAT CAGE AND UNDER THE HOOD VENT

item.description:
Report E-2023100171

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-05
  • City: WILSON
  • State: NC

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that one of the straps had punctured the side of one of the 275 poly tote of araldrite (na1993) and had released 10 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report X-2023090625
item.description:
Report X-2023090625

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-11
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The sequence of events of the actual incident are unknown, other than the incident occurred during the Preload Sort. Package had been discovered already in the Hazmat processing area. When discovered, action was taken to start the damage hazmat process. DescribePack: Package failure occurred when two caps on two of the four bottles came loose and leaked into the carton. Caps had not been sealed on tight. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package had already been discovered in the Hazmat holding/processing area, so it had been removed from the origin of incident location. Therefore, minimizing exposure of spillage to those untrained in handing Hazmats.
